titleStmt.title: Maṣḥafanǝfq "Book of the Assistant Priest"; Ṣalota ʿǝṭān "Prayer of Incense"

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.note: It contains excerpts from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse and from the Acts of the Apostles.
msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ ወይትመጦ፡ ንፍቅ፡ በማህፈድ፨ በከመ፡ ገነዙከ፡ ሥጋከ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወኒቆዲሞስ፡ ወሰመርከ፡ ሎሙ፨ ከማሁ፡ ሥመር፡ ለነ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ውኩፍ፡ አኰቴት፡ ወዕበይ፡ ለሥርየተ፡ ኃጢአት፡ እምኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን፨ ፨ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይስማዕከ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘሰአልኮ፡ ወይትወከፍ፡ መባአከ፡ ወቍርባነከ፡ In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. And the assistant priest shall receive it into a covering (and say): "As Joseph and Nicodemus wrapped Your body in linen and You were well pleased with them, in the like manner be well pleased with us". May the hallowing, thanksgiving and the magnificence be accepted by the Lord the Father for the forgiveness of sins. Amen. May the Lord hear you in all that you have asked, and accept your sacrifice and offering
msItem.explicit: በረከቶሙ፡ ወትንብልና፡ ሣህሎሙ፡ ወገድለ፡ [n.l.]ማሆሙ። ወጸጋ፡ ረዲኦቶሙ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ አቡነ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፨ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ኦንጉሠ፡ ሰላም፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ሰላመ፡ ሀበነ፡ ወአጽንዕ፡ ሰላምከ፡ ላዕለ፡ ወስረይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፨ ንሑር፡ ወንዕቱ፡ በሰላም፡ ውስተ፡ አብያቲነ፨ May their blessing and intercession, their compassion and the acts of their labour, and the grace of their help be with ʾabuna Kidāna Māryām. Forever and ever. Amen. O king of peace, Jesus Christ, give us the peace and confirm (us) in Your peace and forgive us our sins. May we leave and enter our homes in peace.
msItem.note:
The text Maṣḥafa nǝfq is compared to the printed edition Maṣḥafa qǝddāse. Ba-gǝʿǝzna ba-ʾamarǝñña, Addis Abäba 1962 A.M. [1970 A.D.]. The sections composing it are listed in detail below (for the folios and lines of the texts in the Ms. it is given the correspondent texts of the printed versions as follows: for the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse [MQ], in sequence the name of the section, the chapter [ch.], the paragraph [§], the lines from the beginning of the paragraph and a word from the beginning of the line): I-1) Public liturgy: 2r, ls.1-8: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, §§ 12-13) 2r, l.9-2v, l.3/1: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 23) 2v, ls.3/2-4/2: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 25, l.4/2-5). I-2) Prayer of oblation, excerpts from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse): 2v, l.4/3-3r, l.2/1: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 41) 3r, ls.2/2-14/3: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 44, ls.1-10/5). I-3) Fǝtḥat za-wald “Absolution of the Son”, excerpts from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse): 3r, l.14/4-3v, l.12/2: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 56) 3v, l.12/3-4r, l.4/3: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 57) 4r, l.4/4-4v, l.5/1: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 58) 4v, ls.5/2-14/2: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 59) 4v, l.14/3-5r, l.5/3: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 60). I-4) General absolution: excerpts from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse): 5r, l.5/4-5v, l.4/2: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 61) 5v, ls.4/3-10/1: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 62) 5v, l.10/2-6r, l.7/2: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 63) 6r, ls.7/3-10/1: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 64) 6r, ls.10/2-15: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 65). I-5) Concluding chant after the reading from the Pauline Epistles (from the Liturgy of the Word): 6r, l.16-6v, l.5/2: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 132) 6v, ls.5/3-11: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 133) 6v, l.12-7r, l.4/1: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 134)
7r, ls.4/2-12: excerpt from the Maṣḥafa qǝddāse (MQ, Śǝrʿāta qǝddāse, ch. III, § 135).
I-6) Excerpt from the Acts of the Apostles, Acts 23:1-11 (7r, l.13-8v, l.11/2).
I-7) ? (8v, ls.11/3 -17).

msItem.title: Ṣalota ʿǝṭān "Prayer of Incense"
msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፡ በሰላም፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ዘፈነዎ፡ ወኃደረ፡ ውስተ፡ ማህፀና፡ ለድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ቅድስት። ሰላም፡ እምኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር። ወእግዚአ፡ ኵሉ፡ ፍጥረት፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ወኢመኑሂ፡ ኈልቈ፡ ሰብሐቲሁ፡ ለመለኮት። In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the prayer of Incense in the peace to the Lord, the Father, the Son, Whom (They) sent and Who dwellt in the womb of the Virgin Saint Mary. Peace (is) from God and the Lord of all creatures. There is no one who can count the glory of the Divinity.
msItem.explicit: ወንሴብሐከ፡ እኩት፡ ወስቡሕ፡ ስምከ፡ እግዚኦ፨ በእግዚአብሔር፡ ስምከ፡ ዘእምቅድመ፡ ዓለም፡ በአማኑኤል፡ ስምከ፤ ዘይትመዋዕ፡ ለፀር፡ በኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፤ መድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፨ በላዕለ፡ ዝንቱ፤ አስማቲከ፨ ተማህፀንኩ፡ አነ፡ ገብርከ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፨ ወጸሐፊሃ፡ አቡነ፡ ወልደ፡ ሙሴ። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ And we glorify You, Your name (is) praised and glorified, o Lord. Your name (is) in the Lord, Who (is) from before the world; Your name (is) in Emmanuel, Who was condemned for the enemy, in Jesus Christ, Savior of the world. On everything Your names. I, Your servant Kidāna Māryām, received in trust. And its (of the book) copyist (is) ʾabuna Walda Muse. Forever and ever. Amen.

note.p: The Ṣalota ʿǝṭan is compared to the printed edition Ṣalota ʿǝṭan, Addis Abäba 1951 A.M. [1959 A.D.] (SEtan).
The sections composing it are listed in detail below (it is given the page, the lines from the beginning of the page and a word from the beginning of the line):

msItem.note: - Text I, Maṣḥafa nǝfq, ends with the following subscriptio (17r, ls.13-14):
ተፈጸመ፡ [መጽ]ሐፈ፡ ንፍቅ፡ በሰላም፨፨, “The book of nǝfq was completed in peace”.
The subscriptio is separated from the main text with a black line.
- Text II, Ṣalota ʿǝṭan, ends with the following subscriptio (36v, ls.12-17):

ተፈጸመ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ንፍቅ፡ ወጸሎተ፡ ዕጣን፨ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አሜን፨ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፤ አድኅን[n.l.] መከራ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ለደቂቀ፡ [ዛ]ቲ፡[n.l.]መቅደስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡, “The book of nǝfq and the prayer of incense were completed in the peace of the Lord. Amen. O my Lady Mary, save the children of this sanctuary [from] the temptation of the body and of the soul. Forever and ever”.

The subscriptio is separated from Text II by means of a simple band made of two parallel red lines with a black one in between; two short red lines are perpendicular to them, one in the centre of the band and one to its right side.
- On 25v, 26r, 27v one written line at the bottom is written below the ruling.
- ff. 1-2 are ruled but have no text.

supportDesc.condition: Some folios are affected by humidity. Cuts carefully amended on 21, 37, 38. Small holes on 25 and 27.

layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: five red and black dot vertical colon (e.g., 8r, l.5, 15v, l.1).
II. Four dot asterisk (e.g., 17r, l.5, 18r, l.3);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
doubled nine dot asterisks (e.g., 2r, ls.9-10, 17, l.14);
nine dot asterisk followed by two parallel chains of red and black dots (esp. 7r, l.12).

handDesc.handNote:
Mediocre but well-trained. Black; red (strong vermilion). Walda Muse (mentioned as the scribe in the subscriptio of Text II, 36v, ls.9-10).Second half of the 19th century.
ወዕ፡ ? (esp. 5r, l.5)
ይዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ (esp. fol.11r, l.13)
ይካ፡ for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ (esp. 11r, l.14, 12r, l.9)
ካ፡ for ካህን፡ (esp. 15r, l.10)
Nomina sacra; the names of the donor (or commissioner) and the copyst; the name of King Yoḥannǝs; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; abbreviations. The initial line on the incipit page of Text I (fol. 2r); two lines, alternating with a black line, in the incipit page of Text II (fol. 17v); incipit (1-3 words) of some subsections in Texts I and II (esp. fols. 3r, l.15, 5r, l.7, 11r, l.3, 14v, l.9, 15r, ls. 10-11, 18v, ls.15-16, 19v, ls.8-9, 20r, l.9, 21r, ls.10-11, 21v, ls.1 and 16, 22r, l.11, 23v, l.9, 28v, ls.15-16, 29v, ls.1-2 and 10, 30r, l.11, 30v, ls.8-9 and 16, 31r, l.10). Nomina sacra; the names of the donor (or commissioner) and the copyst; the name of King Yoḥannǝs; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; abbreviations. The initial line on the incipit page of Text I (fol. 2r); two lines, alternating with a black line, in the incipit page of Text II (fol. 17v); incipit (1-3 words) of some subsections in Texts I and II (esp. fols. 3r, l.15, 5r, l.7, 11r, l.3, 14v, l.9, 15r, ls. 10-11, 18v, ls.15-16, 19v, ls.8-9, 20r, l.9, 21r, ls.10-11, 21v, ls.1 and 16, 22r, l.11, 23v, l.9, 28v, ls.15-16, 29v, ls.1-2 and 10, 30r, l.11, 30v, ls.8-9 and 16, 31r, l.10).
The markers of the sixth order of ʾa (እ) and of k (ክ) are very pronounced and distinguishable.
The words እግዚአብሔር and እግዚእ are in most of the cases written with ligature between ግ and ዚ (e.g. 10r, l.7, 13v, l.15, 22v, l.4, 31v, l.4).

decoDesc.decoNote: I) 17r: Crude, coloured (black, reddish-brown) ornamental band at the explicit of Text I (geometric motifs).
II) 17v: Crude, coloured (black, reddish-brown) ornamental band at the incipit of Text II (geometric motifs).

list.item: - Crude notes in pen and in pencil on fols. 1rv, 37r-38v; others in the margins of fols. 12v, 17v, 21r, 24v, 32v, 36v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations. Parchment guard is sewn into the centre fold of quire B (?). A small piece of parchment (?) and a piece of red cotton cloth are in the centre fold of quire V (between 33v-34v).

origin.origDate: Mention of King Yoḥannǝs on 9v (l.12), most probably king Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89). In other MSS. (s., e.g., MR-007, UM-023, MR-023) written by the scribe Walda Muse, also Metropolitan ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-1876) is mentioned.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
